vocabulary.definition: to set or keep apart; not united or joined
vocabulary.example: The Berlin Wall separated East and West Berlin for almost 30 years.

vocabulary.definition: the state or condition of living or existing at the same time or in the same place
vocabulary.example: In Berlin, there was a period of coexistence between socialism in the East and capitalism in the West.

vocabulary.definition: defensive walls or structures to protect a place from attack
vocabulary.example: The Berlin Wall was a series of fortifications meant to prevent people from crossing between East and West.

vocabulary.definition: to keep watch over an area by regularly walking or traveling around it
vocabulary.example: Soldiers would patrol the area near the Berlin Wall to prevent escape attempts.

vocabulary.definition: to seize and hold firmly; to understand fully
vocabulary.example: The smooth surface of the wall made it difficult for people to grasp onto while trying to climb over.
In the East, free artistic expression was unthinkable due to strict government control.
